title: Elon Musk changes his name to Kekius Maximus on X
byline: The world’s richest man, Elon Musk, has sparked speculation after changing his name on his social media platform X to ’’Kekius Maximus’’.

title: Foreign nationals behind cyber scams in Sri Lanka primarily target Chinese nationals
byline: An investigation into financial frauds involving foreign nationals, including Chinese individuals, has revealed that the majority of the accounts targeted in Sri Lanka were those of Chinese nationals, with only a limited number of local accounts affected by the cyberattack, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: BIA one of the safest airports from bird strikes in the world
byline: In the wake of Jeju Airlines plane crash that killed 179 presumably due to a bird strike, the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) is considered one of the safest from bird strikes in the world, an official said.

title: 2024 marks record high in overseas employment
byline: A total of 312,836 individuals went abroad for work during 2024, marking a new record that surpasses the previous high set in 2022, the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) said.

title: Fuel price revision: Kerosene reduced tonight
byline: The fuel price revision took place with the price of a litre of kerosene reduced by Rs. 5, effective from tonight, the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) announced.

title: Second Jeju Air flight suffers landing gear problem in South Korea
byline: A Jeju Air flight from Seoul on Monday was forced to return after encountering a landing gear problem, the airline said, a day after South Korea’s most deadly plane crash.

title: Namal Kumara arrested
byline: The Colombo Crime Division has arrested social activist Namal Kumara, police said.

title: Reduction in bus fares a distant dream: Gemunu
byline: With the government’s decisions on fuel price revisions, reducing bus fares has become a distant dream for the people, Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) Chairman Gemunu Wijerathne said.

title: Customs records revenue exceeding Rs. 1.5 trillion in 2024
byline: By the end of 2024, the Sri Lanka Customs achieved a record-breaking revenue of over Rs. 1.5 trillion, marking the highest annual revenue in its history.

title: We move forward in 2025 with renewed vision and determination: President
byline: Claiming that Sri Lanka achieved significant economic stability as a nation in 2024, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said with this progress as the foundation, the country would move forward in 2025 with renewed vision and determination, working towards creating a prosperous nation and ensuring a beautiful life for everyone.

title: Zimbabwe abolishes death penalty
byline: Zimbabwe’s President Emmerson Mnangagwa has approved a law that abolishes the death penalty in the southern African state with immediate effect.

title: Business community welcomes New Year with positive sentiments
byline: Sri Lanka’s private sector enters year 2025 with optimism as the island nation has somewhat managed to emerge from years of economic turbulence, supported by signs of recovery and a more stable environment.

title: No salt in Sri Lanka till April-May this year
byline: Lanka Salt Hambantota was originally established as a fully state-owned corporation. On January 24, 1997, the Ministry of Finance transferred its ownership of the shares to an external party for Rs. 471 million. At the time of this transfer, approximately 90% of the shares was held by the Employees’ Trust Fund Board, and 10% of those shares was subsequently allocated to the employees of the saltern. Since then, the saltern has been registered un

title: If govt. secures three meals a day throughout the year, it’s enough: Namal
byline: If the current government can ensure that people have at least three meals a day throughout the year, then that will be enough, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa said.

title: Sales tax on 63 essential items unchanged
byline: A gazette notification was issued on December 31, 2024, to maintain the existing import duty on 63 selected items, including essential food items, without any revisions, the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development announced.

title: Exams Dept. to award full marks for three controversial questions and release results
byline: The Examinations Department has decided to award full marks for the three controversial questions from the 2024 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination held recently.

title: Country’s annual birth rate drops significantly to 250,000
byline: The annual birth rate in the country, which previously stood at 350,000, has reportedly dropped significantly, Lady Ridgeway Hospital (LRH) Consultant Paediatrician Dr. Deepal Perera said.

title: Asoka Ranwala’s ‘Dr’ post takes a ridiculous turn
byline: The controversy surrounding former Speaker Asoka Ranwala’s doctorate has taken a bizarre twist, with NPP MP K. Illankumaran from the Jaffna district describing Ranwala as a “Medical Doctor’’.

title: Temporary driving license for 50 hearing and speech impaired individuals
byline: A group of 50 hearing and speech impaired individuals who had undergone special training provided by the Department of Motor Traffic received their driving licenses.

title: I was misunderstood during Aragalaya: Gen. Shavendra
byline: Outgoing Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Shavendra Silva yesterday asserted that he wanted to avoid civilian casualties at all costs caused by military fire during the ‘Aragalaya’ period in 2022, but the rulers misunderstood his strategy, which put him at a disadvantage.
